title: Cedar Creek & Belle Grove National Historical Park: History at Sunset
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     History at Sunset              History at Sunset          History at Sunset  2016 Program Series   "I will guarantee that my line will stand" Ramseur's Attack Against Hayes and Kitching June 10, 7:00 p.m. National Park Service Visitor Contact Station 7712 Main Street, Middletown, VA 22645   "War! Vermont Responds!" - presented by Vermont Historian Howard Coffiffin Followed by NPS Ranger Program "The Valiant Stand of Thomas's Brigade" June 24, 6:30 p.m.  8th Vermont Monument 8739 Valley Pike Middletown, VA 22645    A Diamond in the Rough: The Forgotten Story of the Bowman-Hite Farmstead  July 15, 7:00 p.m.  Bowman-Hite Farm, 621 Bowman's Mill Road (Warren County) Middletown, VA 22645    An Ever-Restless Landscape: Change, Continuity, and the Creation of Cedar Creek and Belle Grove National Historical Park  July 29, 7:00 p.m. National Park Service Visitor Contact Station 7712 Main Street, Middletown, VA    "Attention - Company!" Civil War Soldier for an Evening  August 19, 7:00 p.m.  Belle Grove Plantation 336 Belle Grove Road, Middletown, VA 22645    "Our once beautiful but now desolated Valley" Post-war Shenandoah Valley, Virginia  September 9, 6:00 p.m. Belle Grove Plantation 336 Belle Grove Road, Middletown, VA 22645    "...a perfect slaughterhouse." Battle of Third Winchester Tour  September 23, 5:00 p.m.  Third Winchester Visitor Center 541 Redbud Road, Winchester, VA 22603    "The Long Gray Trail" History of the Valley Turnpike  September 30, 5:00 p.m. Meet at Belle Grove Plantation 336 Belle Grove Road, Middletown, VA 22645    The Battle of Cedar Creek Tour October 14, 4:00 p.m.  National Park Service Visitor Contact Station
